sourcesContent:
import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-standby', templateUrl: './standby.page.html', styleUrls: ['./standby.page.scss'], }) export class StandbyPage implements OnInit { selectedSegment: string = 'Ongoing'; public actionSheetButtons = [ { text: 'Case Report', data: { action: 'report', }, }, { text: 'Vitals History', data: { action: 'vitals', }, }, { text: 'Delete', role: 'destructive', data: { action: 'delete', }, }, { text: 'Cancel', role: 'cancel', data: { action: 'cancel', }, }, ]; constructor() { } ngOnInit() { } }

Cases marked in red indicate no medical response.

When 'Request' is animating, this means that the medic on scene made a request.

The 'Ongoing' tab displays emergencies that are currently occuring.

The 'Ended' tab displays emergencies that ended and do not have a case report filled yet.

The vitals displayed are the latest vitals ones by the medic on scene.
